content.description: An excellent line with thoughtful movement bolted in true Magazine style.  You'll be physically and mentally rewarded after sending this more recent addition to the area's classics!
content.location: To the right of Radical Changes.  Begin on a ledge below the black streak that climbs through 2 small roofs.

climbs.name: Radical Changes
climbs.fa: Kevin Short, Paul Holland, 10/82; FFA: Jim Bodenhamer, Randy Hayden, 10/83

content.description: Mega Classic! Somewhat of a test piece for the grade. Climbs the obvious crack in the middle of the wall. Start at a small west facing corner then on to the smooth face above. Great crack/face climbing with the crux move just below a bulge.
content.protection: Cams/nuts and a few manky bolts/ Anchors up top.

climbs.name: Mirage De Sade
climbs.fa: Kevin Short, Jim Bodenhamer, 10/83; FFA: Tony Morris, c.1992

content.description: Another classic climb! Starts on sustained .10- climbing to marginal rest below crux. Sustained climbing above crux doesn't help the forearms. Great moves and beautiful rock and scenery make this a must do climb for the area or state for that matter.
content.location: This route is the prominent bolted line to the left of Radical Changes.

content.description: This is south facing (like all of Mt. Mag) and these climbs get blasted by the furnace above in the summer. Best to climb here in the Fall/Winter months. This area holds some classic climbs with great rock.
